text: Philip Haig Nitschke (born 8 August 1947) is an Australian humanist, writer and former medical doctor. He is the founder and director of the pro- euthanasia group Exit International. He supported and campaigned for legal euthanasia in the Northern Territory. There, he assisted four people ending their lives while it was legal. Later, the Government of Australia made it against the law again. He is the author of the books Killing Me Softly: Voluntary Euthanasia and the Road to the Peaceful Pill (2005) and The Peaceful Pill Handbook (2006). He has been called "Dr Death" by the media. Nitschke was born in Ardrossan, South Australia. He lives in the Netherlands. ==References== ==Other websites== * Exit International Category:1947 births Category:Living people Category:Australian activists Category:Australian medical doctors Category:Australian writers Category:Euthanasia activists Category:Humanists Category:People from South Australia
title: Philip Nitschke
